bill_title: revise certain provisions related to the practice of veterinary medicine.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to the practice of veterinary medicine. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-12-1 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-1. Any person shall be is deemed in the practice of veterinary medicine who if the person represents himself or herself as or is engaged in the practice of veterinary medicine in any of its branches either directly or indirectly, or uses any words, titles, or letters, to title so as to signify that he the person is a veterinarian, or who for a fee diagnoses, diagnoses; performs a surgical operation; treats, corrects, changes, relieves, or prevents any animal disease, deformity, defect, injury, or other physical or mental condition for a fee; or prescribes, or administers any drug, medicine, appliance, application, or treatment of whatever nature, or performs a surgical operation or manipulation, or conducts any autopsy or biopsy, for the prevention, cure, or relief of a pain, deformity, wound, fracture, or bodily injury, or physical condition or disease of animals, and the biologic, anesthetic, apparatus, or other therapeutic or diagnostic substance or technique for a fee, including acupuncture, dentistry, animal chiropractic, theriogenology, or diagnosis of disease. The term , animals , as used in this section shall mean means all animals other than man, except that this section shall not be applicable to the advertising or the sale of foods and medicines used in commercial feeds for the prevention of livestock diseases and includes fowl, birds, fish, and reptiles, wild or domestic . Section 2. That § 36-12-2 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-2. The following persons shall not be are not considered to be engaging in the practice of veterinary medicine in this state: (1) Those who administer to livestock, title of which rests in himself, or in his regular employer, or free service in any case Any person who administers to livestock that are owned by the person or the person's employer or any person who provides free service ; (2) Those who conduct experimentation in scientific research in the development of methods, technics, or treatment, directly or indirectly applicable to the problems of medicine and who in connection therewith uses animals; (3) Services to poultry in its entirety; (4) Regular students in a legally chartered and recognized an accredited college of veterinary medicine, while in the performance of studies and acts assigned by their instructors duties or actions assigned by their instructors or working under the direct supervision of a licensed veterinarian ; (5) Those who are licensed in another state of the United States when engaged in this state in consultation with veterinarians legally practicing herein, providing such in this state, if the consultation does not exceed thirty days in any one year; (6) Those who are senior students in an approved accredited school of veterinary medicine and who shall obtain from the Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners an undergraduate permit to practice in the office and under the direct supervision of any veterinarian practicing within this state; (7) Those who are employees of the State of South Dakota or the United States of America while in the performance of their duties as such employee; (8) Those selling drugs, medicines, household remedies, or appliances at wholesale or retail and advising as to the use and purpose of such drugs, medicines, household remedies, or appliances ; (9) Veterinary livestock assistants registered by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners who work under the supervision of a veterinarian licensed in the State of South Dakota to perform castration of cattle, swine, goats, and sheep; pregnancy diagnosis by manual palpation; spaying of cattle; nonsurgical embryo transfer; dehorning of cattle; fertility examination of bulls; ultrasound for the purpose of determining pregnancy; and administration of biologics and pharmaceuticals under the order of their supervising veterinarians. The State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to specify the education or training and experience required for veterinary assistants, registration procedures, the fee for registration, and supervision of veterinary assistants; (10) Veterinary technicians engaged in tasks permitted by rules promulgated by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners; (11) A contract feeder or a contract feeder's employee who, in the performance of a contractual obligation to provide care for cattle, sheep, or swine held in their care and custody, personally provide accepted livestock management practices for such cattle, sheep, or swine. For purposes of this section, a contract feeder is a person who, pursuant to a contract, provides care and feed to animals held in pens, pastures, fields, or other enclosures for a period of forty-five days or longer. Accepted livestock management practices include dehorning, castration, docking, pregnancy testing, implanting of growth hormones, or the administration of biologics or pharmaceuticals .

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions related to the practice of veterinary medicine. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-12-2 be amended to read as follows: 36-12-2. The following persons shall not be considered to be engaging in the practice of veterinary medicine in this state: (1) Those who administer to livestock, title of which rests in himself, or in his regular employer, or free service in any case; (2) Those who conduct experimentation in scientific research in the development of methods, technics, or treatment, directly or indirectly applicable to the problems of medicine and who in connection therewith uses animals; (3) Services to poultry in its entirety; (4) Regular students in a legally chartered and recognized college of veterinary medicine, while in the performance of studies and acts assigned by their instructors; (5) Those who are licensed in another state of the United States when engaged in this state in consultation with veterinarians legally practicing herein, providing such consultation does not exceed thirty days in any one year; (6) Those who are senior students in an approved school of veterinary medicine and who shall obtain from the Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners an undergraduate permit to practice in the office and under the direct supervision of any veterinarian practicing within this state; (7) Those who are employees of the State of South Dakota or the United States of America while in the performance of their duties as such employee; (8) Those selling drugs, medicines, household remedies, or appliances at wholesale or retail and advising as to the use and purpose of such drugs, medicines, household remedies, or appliances ; (9) Veterinary livestock assistants registered by the State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners who work under the supervision of a veterinarian licensed in the State of South Dakota to perform spaying of cattle and administration of biologics and pharmaceuticals under the order of their supervising veterinarians. The State Board of Veterinary Medical Examiners shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 for the registration of veterinary livestock assistants .
